scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes stereoviews, mostly of Civil War-era or Civil War-related images. Items in the collection are individually described in the contents list of the finding aid.
Please note: Stereoviews can be viewed without equipment, but Special Collections does have a stereoscope available upon request.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stereoview of a camp scene in which the focal point is five Black musicians. The banjo player and the guitarist are centered, the tamborine man on the outside, the instruments of the other two is difficult to determine. The left image is slightly undertrimmed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Period stereoview by E. & H. T. Anthony, 1865, on yellow mount with title on the reverse, "Libby Prison, North side, Richmond, Va. published by E. & H. T. Anthony, # 3161."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stereoview of a Vivandière playing her drum. Identified on the reverse with a paper label "The Daughter of the Regiment." Vivandieres, sometimes known as cantinieres, were women who followed the army to provide support for the troops. Often, a vivandiere would have been a young woman the daughter of an officer or wife of a non-commissioned officer who wore a uniform and braved battles to provide care for wounded soldiers on the battlefield.
